text: hey guys Thomas show secure now
pan-searing is a cooking technique that
many of us use for quick and easy
weeknight meals but often times do you
end up with something that's bland like
a bland piece of chicken a bland steak
or pork chop well today I'm going to
show you a super simple trick that many
restaurants use to add great flavor to a
dish and the secret is what's left in
your pan
[Music]
in front of me here I have two regular
strip steaks that are just seasoned with
a little bit of salt and pepper and they
are perfectly cooked to a nice rare I
like my steaks rare and I'm just gonna
remove them to a plate so that they can
rest and now I'm gonna show you this
technique in making a delicious pan
sauce so you can see in the bottom of
this cast-iron skillet here there are a
bunch of brown bits that are left in the
pan and these are all little caramelized
pieces of steak and juices that have a
ton of flavor locked in them and this is
gonna be the secret base for our pan
sauce now a pan sauce is really a great
kind of technique you can use so many
different ingredients to create a pan
sauce you could certainly add an onion
some garlic or some shallots finely
minced into the bottom of the pan and
saute that up with the caramelized bits
and that will give you great flavor and
the second step in adding really great
flavour to a pan sauce is in deglazing
and you can deglaze with so many
different things now I love using
alcohol like wine you could use a
fortified wine like sherry or you could
even use a spirit like cognac or brandy
that would be really fantastic today I'm
using a little bit of vermouth and I
think this is gonna add a really nice
herbaceousness to my pan sauce and I'm
gonna turn the heat down add the
vermouth and then using a wooden spoon
all you're gonna do is scrape up those
wonderful brown bits so they get
incorporated into the vermouth the
alcohol gets burned off now if you
didn't want to use alcohol you don't
have to here you could use a little bit
of vinegar that would be fantastic you
can use a chicken stock or a vegetable
stock you could also use just water
that's totally fine really what you're
trying to do is extract all the flavor
from the bottom of the pot up into the
sauce now this has reduced its almost
syrupy so it doesn't take any time at
all and now I'm going to add the final
kind of layer or ingredient and in this
recipe it's cream but what you could do
here is you could add a few tablespoons
of
and that would really add richness to
your sauce that's really what you're
looking for a little bit of richness and
texture to your sauce and you want to
make sure that you don't boil this when
the cream goes in you don't want to boil
milk or boil butter you just want to
incorporate it into your wonderful pan
sauce and then for a final bit of flavor
I'm gonna add some mustard so you can
add mustard in that this is Dijon
mustard so a wonderful flavorful French
mustard but you could also use a grainy
mustard you could add capers or olives
would be really fantastic because again
it gives a bit of a punch and that's
what you're looking for and at this
final point as well you could add some
chopped herbs so I love using woodsy
herbs and these pan sauces like thyme
rosemary would be great marjoram or
oregano would be fantastic and you
really just want to mix this all
together
and then literally of you guys have been
watching me it's a minute and a half it
takes to create this wonderful sauce
that's gonna add so much complexity and
flavor to whatever it is that you're
serving it with whether it be a chicken
cutlet whether it be your steak pork
chops fish even so this is done you guys
I'm gonna turn the heat off you can pour
this into a nice serving bowl or pour it
right over whatever it is that you're
cooking now remember pan sauces are
super super simple you need to of course
start with with those wonderful brown
bits in the bottom of your pan add a
little bit of aromatics like onion or
shallot deglaze with your favorite wine
or chicken stock or vegetable stock or
even water and then finish with a little
bit of richness from butter cream and a
few herbs or something like Dijon
mustard and you will have a wonderful
flavorful pan sauce that will dress up
any dinner any night of the week now
